titleStmt.title: OXFORD AND CAMBRIDGE ISLAMIC MANUSCRIPTS CATALOGUE ONLINE

msContents.summary: Various Arabic and Ottoman Turkish works on subjects of Prayer, Islam, and Hadith

msItem.title: mes̠'eleler
مثٸله‌لر
msItem.author: anonymous
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
mes̠'eles, referring to the rites and observances of Islām, according to the Hanafite doctrine, on ff. 1b-5a, in Turkish.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

author.persName: Abū al-Layth al-Samarqandī, Naṣr ibn Muḥammad, d. 983

msItem.title: mes̠'eleler
مثٸله‌لر
msItem.author: anonymous
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Another short set of mes̠'eles, in Turkish, on fol. 31.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: A tract on days of good and bad omen
msItem.incipit: اعلم قال الله تعالى الحمد لله القديم وقرآن العظيم فأرسلنا عليهم ريحًا صرصرًا فى ايام و مختلف في کلام حسات، وقال ابن عباس الخ
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

A tract on days of good and bad omen, on ff. 33b-52b, in Turkish. Beginning: اعلم قال الله تعالى الحمد لله القديم وقرآن العظيم فأرسلنا عليهم ريحًا صرصرًا فى ايام و مختلف في کلام حسات، وقال ابن عباس الخ. Dated end of Ẕī l-ḥicce, A.H. 1052=A. D. 1643, March 21.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: A treatise on the proper conduct of standardbearers
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
A treatise on the proper conduct of standardbearers, with special regulations as to their prayers, on ff. 53-60b, in Turkish; the first part is headed دعاء سنجاق في البر, the second علمداران.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: A mes̠nevī on the various points of ecclesiastic and civil law
msItem.author: anonymous
msItem.incipit: هر که یولداش اوله دائم روضة الاسلاميلة حق تعالی آنی معمور ایلیه ایمانیله
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

A mes̠nevī on the various points of ecclesiastic and civil law, by an anonymous author, styled (), on ff. 61b-123a, in Turkish; it contains fifty bābs, and begins with a single beyt: هر که یولداش اوله دائم روضة الاسلاميلة حق تعالی آنی معمور ایلیه ایمانیله, after which immediately follows the index of the fifty bābs in prose; the poem itself begins, on fol. 62b, last line, thus: چون بسم الله اولدی ابتداسی ينه حمديله اولسون انتهاسی

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: an anonymous mes̠nevī
msItem.incipit: رسول الله حدیثنده بیوردی اسلام قیدنی نجه قیوردی كور
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
A similar, but shorter mes̠nevī on the five fundamental laws of Islām, on ff. 123b-131b, in Turkish. Beginning: رسول الله حدیثنده بیوردی اسلام قیدنی نجه قیوردی كور.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: Taḳvīm-i Şeyḫ Vefā
تقویم شیخ وفا
Rūznāme-i Şeyḫ Vefā
روزنامه شیخ وفا
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.
Another copy of Şeyḫ Vefā's تقویم, or perpetual calendar (see Nos. 2193-2195 above), on ff. 132b-140a, in Turkish.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.author: Anonymous
msItem.title: A funeral prayer, preceded by a ḥadīth of the Prophet
A tract on the natural phenomena
msItem.note: NOTE: This record has been automatically generated with minimal modification from the corresponding entry in a printed catalogue. It may contain errors. Please, consult the References section below for more information.

A tract on the natural phenomena, wind, rain, thunderstorms, etc., which appear in the different months of the year, and their effect upon temperature, etc., on ff. 143-156b, in Turkish. It begins with March (), on fol. 143; April () appears on fol. 144a; May (), on fol. 145a; June (), on fol. 146a; July (), on fol. 147a; August (), on fol. 148a; September (very indistinctly written), on fol. 149a; October () on fol. 150a; November (), on fol. 151b; December (heading missing, this month seems to begin on fol. 153a); January (), on fol. 154b; February (), on fol. 155b.

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

msItem.title: mes̠'eles

bibl.ref: Ethé, Hermann. Catalogue of the Persian, Turkish, Hindûstânî and Pushtû Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Part II: Turkish, Hindûstânî, Pushtû and Additional Persian Manuscripts. Oxford: Clarendon Press. 1930. § (254) 2292.

history.provenance: The collections of Jacob Golius [see Golius Sale Catalogue, Libri Miscellanei M.S. in quarto &c, no. 58].
The Library of Archbishop Narcissus Marsh, d. 1713.
history.acquisition: The Marsh bequest entered the Bodleian Library in 1714.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on the Bodleian Library's public card index of Arabic manuscripts with additional enhancements by the OCIMCO project team.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions).
